subject: p12189285
Findings: The patient has a right-sided dialysis line in unchanged position. Sternotomy wires are identified in an unusual position. There is unchanged cardiomegaly. Wedge-shaped opacification in the right lower lobe is unchanged as is pleural blunting and effusion in the left base. There is only a tiny amount of increased peribronchial opacification when compared to the prior study. There is no evidence for pulmonary edema.
Impression: Loculated fluid right base and chronic fluid in left base. There is probably a small amount of increased fluid over the prior radiograph. There is cardiomegaly and unusually orientated sternal wires probably reflecting sternal dehiscence.
